meanings.definition: A sudden, involuntary muscle contraction or convulsive movement.
meanings.sent1: During the game, he experienced painful spasms in his leg.
meanings.sent2: She felt spasms of pain shoot through her back after lifting the heavy box.
meanings.sent3: The robot's spasms made it dance around the room uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The storm caused spasms of lightning to light up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the alarm triggered spasms of fear in the young child.

meanings.definition: A sudden, violent, and temporary effort, emotion, or sensation.
meanings.sent1: Her laughter turned into spasms of tears when she heard the sad news.
meanings.sent2: The audience erupted into spasms of applause at the end of the performance.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes caused spasms of laughter throughout the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The sudden burst of anger led to spasms of shouting and slamming doors.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected joy brought on spasms of happiness that she couldn't contain.
